Headline: Yellow Line Service Temporarily Suspended
ShortDescription: Service on the Yellow Line continues to be temporarily suspended following an incident at Howard.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Service on the Yellow Line continues to be temporarily suspended following a recent incident at Howard.

Shuttle bus service is available between Howard and Skokie/Dempster, serving all affected stations during normal hours of operation.

At this time, also consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines. These may include the #97 Skokie bus route.

We are working to restore service as soon as possible. We apologize for the inconvenience and appreciate your understanding.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: #56 Milwaukee Temporary Northbound Reroute near Milwaukee/Elston
ShortDescription: Northbound 56 Milwaukee buses are temporarily rerouted via Milwaukee, Chicago, Noble, Augusta and Milwaukee due to street blockage.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Northbound #56 Milwaukee buses are temporarily rerouted via Milwaukee, Chicago, Noble, Augusta and Milwaukee due to street blockage near Milwaukee/Elston.

Southbound buses are not affected.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Red Line Subway Trains Rerouted to Elevated Tracks
ShortDescription: Red Line subway trains are rerouted to the elevated lines between Fullerton and Cermak-Chinatown due to a sick passenger at Jackson.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Red Line subway trains are rerouted to the elevated lines between Fullerton and Cermak-Chinatown due to a sick passenger at Jackson.

We apologize for the inconvenience and are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.

Red Line service to 95th/Dan Ryan

After stopping at Fullerton, 95th-bound trains will be diverted and will make the following elevated station stops:

  • Armitage (accessible)
  • Sedgwick (accessible)
  • Chicago (at Franklin; accessible)
  • Merchandise Mart (accessible)
  • Clark/lake (accessible)
  • State/Lake
  • Washington/Wabash (accessible)
  • Adams/Wabash
  • Roosevelt (elevated station west of Wabash; accessible)

Then, trains will stop at Cermak-Chinatown and make all normal stops to 95th/Dan Ryan.

Red Line service to Howard

For service toward Howard, after stopping at Cermak-Chinatown, trains will then be diverted to the above-listed elevated stations, in the opposite order, through Armitage and then make all normal stops from Fullerton to Howard.

For service in areas away from where the Red Line is running

Consider using local bus alternatives through the area where you're traveling, including those to other train lines or where Red Line service has been rerouted to operate.
